ygData.subject: Re: Oasis Warning
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree with Vicki!  When Sierra s customer service went down, we (on the realm) were all informed that Middle Earth wouldnt even be started for at least a
ygData.messageBody:
I agree with Vicki! When Sierra's customer service went down, we (on
the realm) were all informed that Middle Earth wouldnt even be started
for at least a year, if not more.

Also, Stephen Nichols is the one who is doin all the developing. As
any realmer (ex realmer even) knows, Stephen blew us ALL off and left
for greener pastures. He was one of the only ones actually
implementing stuff in the game, when he dumped the game, everything
suffered. Any game being worked on by such a fickle person would have
to suck. Maybe not at first, but eventually he'll lose interest in
that and dump it too.



--- Vicki <vicki@...> wrote:
> From: "Vicki" <vicki@...>
>
> > From: "Azor" <jmaynus@...>
> > Realm. The Realm at first was a big game, but
> over time ppl got tired of
> it
> > and they quit playing where is the Realm now? It
> might still be there but
> > how often is it updated, how many ppl are on there
> now to play with or
> > against? I like EQ about as much as the next
> person, but I have a feeling
> > we won't see it around or as big as it is now for
> I'd say 2-3 more years,
> > with games such as Middle-Earth, Asherions Call
> and I've heard of one more
>
>
> If you played Realm then you would know better then
> to even think for one
> minute that with Stephen involved in Middle Earth -
> it's not going to be
> anything but a mess. I don't think he could program
> his way out of a paper
> bag! And I for one will NEVER buy a game that he is
> involved in.
> Been there, done that! lol
>
> People left Realm to come here for the most part,
> Sierra is in trouble -
> Middle Earth is not being worked on at this time and
> it will be years before
> it comes out if ever. It would not surprise me to
> see somewhere down the
> road that Sierra sells the rights to it.
>
> Its the same with everything in life, things change
> and in the computer
> industry they improve at an alarming rate. On a
> Monday you can buy a state
> of the art CD Rom and by Friday something better has
> come out.
>
> I mean 2-3 years for a game is a very long time. I
> love EQ just as much as
> the next person (for now-hehe) but that won't stop
> me from looking around
> when something better comes out :)
>
>
